data.title: Default to running in stable mode, and add a --dev flag
data.body:
This will prevent problems like people pulling and forgetting to recompile, then having the JS not match expectations for the native layer.

Also, we should replace `openStable` with `openDev`, so you can open a dev-mode window from the stable application.

data.title: Browser resource loading should respect the load path
data.body: Currently, we have a load path that `require` uses to resolve paths to script files, and we also use this load path in `requireStylesheet`. But resource references in the HTML such as images or fonts don't respect this load path... they are just loading relative to the page's static path on disk. I'd like the browser component to respect the same load path that require does, so that we can resolve relative resource paths to a variety of locations. This will allow themes and packages to easily pull resources that they package for themselves.

data.title: Placing closing HTML tag onto newline predictably triggers RangeError
data.body: Whenever I go to put this `` tag onto a new line, Atom will predictably pop up the web inspector panel to tell me there was a `RangeError`: ![atom-pre-error](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/106891/67a9f106-6a12-11e2-8e0f-710c3fd19bd0.gif) The error’s stack trace from the console is as follows: ``` Uncaught RangeError: Invalid array length underscore-extensions.coffee:69 _.mixin.multiplyString underscore-extensions.coffee:69 module.exports.EditSession.buildIndentString edit-session.coffee:219 module.exports.EditSession.setIndentationForBufferRow edit-session.coffee:201 module.exports.LanguageMode.autoDecreaseIndentForBufferRow language-mode.coffee:249 module.exports.LanguageMode.autoIndentBufferRow language-mode.coffee:216 module.exports.EditSession.autoIndentBufferRow edit-session.coffee:604 module.exports.Selection.insertText selection.coffee:303 (anonymous function) edit-session.coffee:357 (anonymous function) edit-session.coffee:627 module.exports.EditSession.transact edit-session.coffee:499 module.exports.EditSession.mutateSelectedText edit-session.coffee:621 module.exports.EditSession.insertText edit-session.coffee:356 object.(anonymous function) underscore-extensions.coffee:28 module.exports.EditSession.insertNewline edit-session.coffee:362 module.exports.Editor.insertNewline editor.coffee:535 (anonymous function) editor.coffee:298 jQuery.event.dispatch jquery.js:3256 elemData.handle.eventHandle jquery.js:2875 jQuery.event.trigger jquery.js:3144 (anonymous function) jquery.js:3781 jQuery.extend.each jquery.js:658 jQuery.fn.jQuery.each jquery.js:271 jQuery.fn.extend.trigger jquery.js:3780 $.fn.trigger command-logger.coffee:87 module.exports.Keymap.triggerCommandEvent keymap.coffee:168 module.exports.Keymap.handleKeyEvent keymap.coffee:129 _handleKeyEvent window.coffee:80 jQuery.event.dispatch jquery.js:3256 elemData.handle.eventHandle jquery.js:2875 ```

data.title: A wild phantom caret appears
data.body:
So I have no idea how this happened, but just now I wound up with a second input caret that isn’t part of the whole multiple cursor functionality thing. It just sits there, blinking soullessly at me, regardless of what I do with the normal caret. An GIF:

![atom-phantom-caret](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/296432/106862/1baa004a-6a10-11e2-97a2-866c1bcc623d.gif)

Note that:
- it doesn’t move or alter text the way it should if atom was in multiple cursor mode.
- Adding to the start of the phantom cursor’s line does not increment the caret position.
- moving the real caret over the phantom caret does not clear it.

Switching to a different tab and back again cleared it for me.

data.title: Markdown preview disappears when Atom loses focus
data.body:
When previewing a Markdown file then switch away from Atom, the preview disappears reverting back to the source Markdown. When I'm reading a long Markdown file, this loses my scroll position and interrupts my flow -- in my case, I was comparing the Markdown file with a website.

Would love to have this stick around.

Related: I could also see previewing a Markdown file and wanting to switch to another open buffer and back without losing the preview.

data.title: Scrollbar at bottom of editor window blocks bottom line
data.body:
When lines get too long, the horizontal scrollbar on the bottom of the editor window blocks the text on the bottom line of the file. If you're at the end of the file, you can't scroll down any further, so you can't see what you're typing.

![user rb _Users_derek_github_github_app_models](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/60566/105220/778ebf96-69a1-11e2-9afb-80e647953010.png)

data.title: Can't switch to different editor in new pane.
data.body: I use cmd-alt-right to split the pane in two but when I ctrl-w w to get to the other pane to switch to the other pane. This works well. In the newly selected pane I use cmd-b to switch my pane to use the new buffer and it switches the previous pane's buffer instead.

data.title: error running rake install
data.body:
I tried this more than once and got the same error. I blew away the atom repo and gh-setup'd and it still persists. I'm not on boxen (yet) if that makes a difference.

``` bash
 atom $ rake install
npm http GET https://registry.npmjs.org/coffee-script
npm http GET https://registry.npmjs.org/cson
npm http 304 https://registry.npmjs.org/coffee-script
npm http 304 https://registry.npmjs.org/cson
npm http GET https://registry.npmjs.org/js2coffee
npm http 304 https://registry.npmjs.org/js2coffee
npm http GET https://registry.npmjs.org/underscore
npm http 304 https://registry.npmjs.org/underscore
rake aborted!
No such file or directory - gyp --depth=. atom.gyp

Tasks: TOP => install => build => create-project
(See full trace by running task with --trace)
```

data.title: Merge dev into master
data.body:
### Highlights
- Faster launch
- Web worker support
- Move lines up and down with `ctrl-cmd-up/down`
- Python bundle now included
- `CRLF` support
- New folding decorations
- Mouse/keyboard usage stats graph via `cmd-alt-s`
- Bracket pair highlighting of `([{}])` and jump to matching bracket with `ctrl-j`
- Config file can now be CSON at `~/.atom/config.cson`
- Toggle full screen mode with `ctrl-cmd-f`
- Duplicate current line with `cmd-D`

data.title: Add ctrl-tab shortcut to switch panes
data.body:
`ctrl-tab` mirrors the browser behavior of tab jumping between inputs.

It also opens the door to having ctrl-shift-tab jump back to the previous pane, though I haven't touched in this PR.

I kept `ctrl-w w` for the vim people but would prefer we view that as compat - Atom shouldn't force you to use two keystrokes for core functionality.

data.title: The currently highlighted tab shows more tab
data.body:
Through the power of `-webkit-box-flex` I've re-written the tabs so that the current tab will flex larger to show of it's sexy tab name.

![animated-2013-01-25_16h-28m-58s](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/54012/99233/6a81f4a2-674f-11e2-81bd-e198d1594c9f.gif)

data.title: Add jump to line
data.body: triggered by `meta-l`

data.title: ctrl-k semantics and no ctrl-y
data.body:
Text entry areas on OS X implement a few readline/emacs keystrokes, including ctrl-k for "kill to end of line" and ctrl-y for "yank from kill buffer". I use them both a lot and in particular, this is the behavior I expect:
- Cutting a line with ctrl-k goes into the undo manager, but not into the system pasteboard:
- Text cut with ctrl-k can be pasted with ctrl-y to any other window in the same application, but the ctrl-k buffer is per-application

In other words, you can't command-v something you've cut with ctrl-k, and the ctrl-k kill buffer is application-wide.

Right now ctrl-k is bound to `editor:cut-to-end-of-line` in the emacs keymapping, but it affects the global pasteboard and there's no ctrl-y counterpart. 

It might be worth adding a ctrl-y mapping and changing ctrl-k/ctrl-y behavior to make Atom seem more native on Mac.

data.title: Typing in fuzzy finder too fast
data.body:
Sometimes on a newly opened project I'll `meta-t` then start typing the file I want to open immediately.

When I do it too fast a js error turns up.

![Screen Shot 2013-01-25 at 9 33 37 AM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/54012/98149/894dfab4-6715-11e2-9da0-443f191e547c.png)

data.title: nakajima's wishlist and bugs
data.body:
- [ ] Chrome-style tab closing (the tabs stay the same size when you're closing multiple tabs, so the 'x' stays in the same place until you move your cursor)
- [x] Command to copy current file path to clipboard
- [ ] Git blame
- [x] The ability to select a word, then press `[`, `(`, `"`, or `'` and have that character wrap the selection, TextMate-style.
